coredata.dc:title: Self-understanding and self-extension: A systems and representational approach
coredata.prism:publicationName: IEEE Transactions on Autonomous Mental Development

abstract.ce:para: There are many different approaches to building a system that can engage in autonomous mental development. In this paper, we present an approach based on what we term self-understanding, by which we mean the explicit representation of and reasoning about what a system does and does not know, and how that knowledge changes under action. We present an architecture and a set of representations used in two robot systems that exhibit a limited degree of autonomous mental development, which we term self-extension. The contributions include: representations of gaps and uncertainty for specific kinds of knowledge, and a goal management and planning system for setting and achieving learning goals. © 2009 IEEE.

affiliation.affilname: German Research Center for Artificial Intelligence (DFKI)

xocs:funding-list.xocs:funding-text: Manuscript received March 01, 2010; revised September 13, 2010; accepted October 12, 2010. Date of publication November 01, 2010; date of current version December 10, 2010. This work was supported in part by the EC FP7 IST Project CogX-215181.

item-info.copyright: Copyright 2011 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.

citation-title.titletext: Self-understanding and self-extension: A systems and representational approach

abstract.ce:para: There are many different approaches to building a system that can engage in autonomous mental development. In this paper, we present an approach based on what we term self-understanding, by which we mean the explicit representation of and reasoning about what a system does and does not know, and how that knowledge changes under action. We present an architecture and a set of representations used in two robot systems that exhibit a limited degree of autonomous mental development, which we term self-extension. The contributions include: representations of gaps and uncertainty for specific kinds of knowledge, and a goal management and planning system for setting and achieving learning goals. © 2009 IEEE.

source.sourcetitle: IEEE Transactions on Autonomous Mental Development
source.issuetitle: SPECIAL ISSUE ON REPRESENTATIONS AND ARCHITECTURES FOR COGNITIVE SYSTEMS
